title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server VMs broken by October updates
description: Microsoft fixed a known issue causing blue screens and boot failures in Windows Server 2022 virtual machines (VMs) deployed on VMware ESXi hosts. [...]

title: Citrix Hypervisor gets hotfix for new Reptar Intel CPU flaw
description: Citrix has released hotfixes for two vulnerabilities impacting Citrix Hypervisor, one of them being the "Reptar" high-severity flaw that affects Intel CPUs for desktop and server systems. [...]

title: Toronto Public Library confirms data stolen in ransomware attack
description: The Toronto Public Library (TPL) confirmed that the personal information of employees, customers, volunteers, and donors was stolen from a compromised file server during an October ransomware attack. [...]

title: FBI and CISA warn of opportunistic Rhysida ransomware attacks
description: The FBI and CISA warned today of Rhysida ransomware gang's opportunistic attacks targeting organizations across multiple industry sectors. [...]

title: PJ&A says cyberattack exposed data of nearly 9 million patients
description: PJ&A (Perry Johnson & Associates) is warning that a cyberattack in March 2023 exposed the personal information of almost nine million patients. [...]

title: Fraud researchers impersonated on X to push crypto-stealing sites
description: Multiple fake accounts impersonating cryptocurrency scam investigators and blockchain security companies are promoting phishing pages to drain wallets in an ongoing campaign on X (former Twitter). [...]

title: Fraudsters make $50,000 a day by spoofing crypto researchers
description: Multiple fake accounts impersonating cryptocurrency scam investigators and blockchain security companies are promoting phishing pages to drain wallets in an ongoing campaign on X (former Twitter). [...]

title: The OWASP Top 10: What They Are and How to Test Them
description: This article takes a deep dive into the OWASP Top 10 and advises on how to test your web applications for susceptibility to these security risks. [...]

title: IPStorm botnet with 23,000 proxies for malicious traffic dismantled
description: The U.S. Department of Justive announced today that Federal Bureau of Investigation took down the network and infrastructure of a botnet proxy service called IPStorm. [...]
